text.__SUMMARY__: Conus leobottonii, common name, the Sartorial cone, is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails and their allies.Like all species within the genus Conus, these snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all.
text.Description: The size of an adult shell varies between 27 mm and 53 mm.
text.Distribution: This species is found in the Pacific Ocean off the Philippines.
text.References:
